context.item: You will be provided with multiple images. The initial images are examples and should NEVER be analyzed under any circumstances.
You will analyze ONLY the final image provided, which will be clearly indicated as the target for analysis.
In this final image, search for handwritten text elements that can be transcribed to structured output.
Your task is to identify, analyze, and transcribe handwritten text from the final image only, including cursive, print, historical, and modern handwriting styles.
You will analyze various types of page scans while searching for handwritten text elements. Page scans could contain one or more handwritten text regions.
Your task is to identify and extract the content of handwritten text, including letters, words, sentences, and document structures.
You should capture detailed transcriptions while preserving semantic meaning, structure, and contextual relationships.
If you're unsure about specific characters or words, refer to the guidance in the XML tags.
Handwritten text typically contains connected or disconnected characters formed by human writing implements, varying in style, legibility, and historical period.
If no genuine handwritten text is found, respond according to the instructions in the XML tags.
When in doubt, prioritize accuracy over completeness.
You will use a multi-step verification process with confidence scoring to identify and validate handwritten text, found within the XML tags.
